jobs.title: Associate, Employee Engagement
jobs.description:
With close to $4bn in loans flowing through its systems, OakNorth AI is the leading player in the bespoke mid-sized loans segment, and has partnered with lending institutions around the world to unlock this under-served market. 

OakNorth Analytical Intelligence (ON AI) is a FinTech platform unlocking the under-served and underestimated market for bespoke loans to SMEs. It does this by leveraging data, machine learning and technology to make a previously unprofitable market segment highly attractive. By deploying our platform globally, we are growing our footprint within the financial services industry and helping our clients reach previously untapped market segments.
 
The company was founded by Rishi Khosla and Joel Perlman, serial entrepreneurs, who proved the concept for OakNorth Analytical Intelligence via OakNorth - a bank they founded in 2015 to address the mid-market funding gap in the UK. The bank became profitable after just 11 months and within a period of less than two years, has grown its loan book to $1.7bn. The group is the fastest in European history to become a unicorn (30 months from inception) and counts GIC, Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund, among its investors. The management team has backgrounds from leading tech and financial institutions such as Palantir Technologies, Amazon, Apple, Intel and Goldman Sachs.

This a wide-ranging role, encompassing the efficient management of employee engagement activities through a range of projects including social events, business briefs, performance management, cultural change and corporate responsibility.

You will:

- Collaborate with functional leaders and key employees to maximise the impact of your activities on employee engagement and retention
- Regularly catch up with employees, collect feedback and update leadership team on any concerns
- Analyse and recognise patterns in employee data (i.e. metrics such as employee survey results and turnover etc.) to shape engagement activities, drive action, maximise impact and evaluate success
- Demonstrate our company values through your work and develop new ways of working geared to further embed the values in employee’s daily lives and behaviours
- Monitor employee engagement and work closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention
- Participate in company-wide programs and initiatives (e.g., annual performance management, mentorship, coaching and training, workforce planning and organizational change, etc.)
- Coach and counsel managers on effective management/supervisory skills to motivate and reward high performing employees
- Partner with the talent team to attract and retain a diverse and engaged workforce
- Conduct market research and benchmarking studies to understand emerging trends and industry best practice when it comes to employee engagement
- Recommend new approaches, policies, and procedures to effect continual improvements in employee engagement 
- Compile reports and conduct analysis to map issues and demonstrate program efficacy


You have:

- Highly motivated with an enthusiasm for employee engagement; always seeks out new ways to engage with employees
- Able to network effectively and build constructive working relationships across the company
- Ability to present and communicate effectively at all employee levels 
- Possess high EQ and an affable demeanour
- Carry yourself with magnetism and warmth; people should seek you out
- Operates with credibility and inspires confidence and trust of others
- Strong ethical compass and integrity; acts with the utmost of discretion at all times
- Confident decision maker who is able to work independently      
- Exceptional written and verbal communication skills          
- Strong organisation and project management skills; can work under pressure to tight deadlines 
- Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.description:
Some of the things we're interested in:

- Willingness to learn new technologies
- Singular focus on execution and delivery
- Self-starting. This is an opportunity to own a large piece of the tech and -outcomes for the company
- We’re open to expertise any language background, but we use Python/Javascript day to day
- Shell scripting and UNIX familiarity
- Familiarity with CI/CD and willingness to contribute to make our deploy process as smooth as possible
- Some knowledge of modern deploy tools - Docker/Kubernetes/CircleCI
- Strong communication skills

If you have any public GitHub (or other) repositories please let us know. We’d love to see what you like working on!

Benefits:

- Generous compensation
- Your choice of equipment - choose a MacBook Pro or Dell XPS
- Central London office location with discounts in surrounding commercial establishments
- Meritocratic working environment

jobs.title: Office Administrator
jobs.description:
With offices in London, New York, Manchester, Istanbul, Gurgaon, Bengaluru, Shanghai, Singapore and Hong Kong, OakNorth is the next-generation credit platform that’s redefining lending to small and medium-sized businesses globally.
 
OakNorth was set up in 2015 by Rishi Khosla and Joel Perlman, who previously co-founded Copal Amba and grew it to 3,000 employees over 12 years, before selling it to Moody’s (NYSE: MCO) in 2014, returning 125 times capital to seed investors.
 
Since its inception, OakNorth has secured over $1bn from several investors, including: Clermont Group, Coltrane, EDBI of Singapore, GIC, Indiabulls, NIBC, Toscafund, and SoftBank’s Vision Fund.
 
In the UK, the platform has helped us build a profitable loan book (via OakNorth Bank) of over £4bn and secure over £600m of repayments. In terms of the impact this has had on the economy, OakNorth Bank’s loans have directly helped with the creation of 10,000 new homes and 13,000 new jobs in the UK, as well as adding several billion pounds to the economy. Globally, the platform has been deployed at various banks across North America, Europe, and Asia.
 
Today, the global team is made up of almost 730 people.

Office Administrator   

The office administrator will represent OakNorth as the first high-touch point of contact for all stakeholders, including candidates,
clients, and OakNorth employees. This position is a culture carrier across the office, embodying the firm values as well as a highenergy,
collaborative spirit. A significant portion of responsibility will be dedicated to supporting the office with administrative tasks,
client scheduling, event planning and logistics. It is imperative that this person is proactive and takes an ownership approach to the
operations of an incredibly fast-growing and changing US office.
